Job Title: Solutions Specialist 1

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Sales

Description:
About the roleThe Solution Specialist 1 is a key partner of the Account Executive/Sales Representative and is responsible for driving the technical solution strategy and delivering additional revenue from product and services. You will support multiple customer accounts to drive opportunities and new relationships across the business. This role has a Datacenter focus.
What you'll doPartner with business leaders to position and sell product and services that support company objectives and that are consistent with Winning Together values.Technical specialist leading opportunities and deals including bringing in and facilitating the right Subject Matter ExpertsReview customer requirements and identifies key solution elements with the relevant Subject Matter ExpertsProposal development and collaborate with the Pre-Sales Teams to develop competitive final proposals.Attend customer opportunity / strategy meetings to understand, present and articulate business and technical product and services strategy for the company and customer.Provide qualification of designs or opportunities and produce technical architecture/design documentation.Ensure that proposed solutions are valid and meet Customer specifications.Work closely with Sales Teams / Vendors / Partners to keep up-to-date with current and future product and services technologies and strategies to manage the ‘cradle to grave’ service/solution cycle.Drive adherence to business rules, including obtaining Deal Review Process (DRP) approval when required.Lead the review of solution and pricing during the deal reviews as appropriate.Promotes Computacenter’s products and services offerings.Focus on increasing product and services revenue and profitabilityEngage in and manage Customer demonstrations and Proofs of Concept.Play a pivotal role in ensuring end to end delivery to client.Maintain high level of industry awareness through training and self-development.
What you haveLegally eligible to work in the United StatesBachelor’s in Computer Science, Management Information Systems (MIS) (preferred) or related field or equivalent in work experience.2+ years as services and solutioning professional.Strong interpersonal and communication skillsAble to engage, and interact effectively, with people from many different disciplines.Excellent written communication skills.Experience with IT and services delivery methodologies.Understanding and knowledge of IT Trends and Business needs.Ability to develop and maintain client engagements/relationships.Develop and deliver services solutions architecture presentations.Ability to understand client requirements and engage with cross-functional teams for services solutions developmentUnderstand industry and competitive trendsKnowledge of IT Infrastructure technology and its business applicationDemonstrable ability to provide input into commercial/technical documents and to develop services solution specific business casesExcellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to present at large internal and external audiences and at board level.In-depth understanding of service lifecycle.Ability to lead and organize a large virtual teamGood negotiation skillsStrong proposal writing abilityAbility to manage multiple opportunitiesAbility to determine appropriate solution approach and pricing strategies for opportunities
What you can expectThere’s so much more to enjoy about being at Computacenter than just having a rewarding career. In addition to offering competitive compensation plans and long-term career opportunities, we provide an attractive mix of benefit plans to contribute to your good health, future financial security, and peace of mind.
About usComputacenter is a leading independent technology partner, trusted by large corporate and public sector organizations. We help our world-renowned customers to source, transform, and manage their IT infrastructure to deliver digital transformation, enabling users and their business. We’re a public company quoted on the London FTSE 250 (CCC.L) and employ over 20,000 people worldwide. In the US, we support some of the country’s best-known businesses with regional hubs in San Francisco and Irvine, CA; Norcross, GA; Plano, TX; and New York City; and Integration Centers in Silicon Valley and Atlanta. www.computacenter.com/us

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
